New Records: The Guardians are the first in AL postseason history to score five runs without an out being recorded.
Key Match Events: Lane Thomas hit a three-run homer in the first inning
Bibee retired the first two men he faced in the fifth, but when Parker Meadows singled from the leadoff spot, the bullpen was summoned.
The best bullpen in the big leagues hadn’t pitched in six days, so why not?
Emmanuel Clase retired the Tigers in order to complete the four-hit shutout.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Stephen Vogt emphasized the importance of staying ready for the postseason.
Tiger manager A.J. Hinch predicted that Cleveland’s lineup would be difficult to overcome.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Stephen Vogt praised the team’s performance, saying 'This is great for our guys.'
Manager A.J. Hinch acknowledged the difficulty of overcoming Cleveland’s lineup, saying 'They punch you with five in the first, it’s hard to overcome.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played on a sunny Saturday afternoon at Progressive Field.
The Guardians earned a bye to reach the ALDS by finishing with the second-best record in the league.
Others: Cade Smith struck out four straight batters in his postseason debut.
Tim Herrin started the seventh and retired three straight Tigers, two on strikeouts.
